sen.j: 鬼子母神（きしもじん/きしぼじん）、 haaritii、ハーリティー）は仏教を守護するとされる夜叉で女神の一尊。
sen.e: Kishimojin or Kishibojin (Goddess of Children, haaritii in Sanskrit) is yaksha (Buddhist guardian deities sometimes depicted as demonic warriors) and a goddess.
Kishimojin' or 'Kishibojin' (haaritii in Sanskrit, Goddess of Children) is a yasha (yaksha in Sanskrit, Buddhist deity sometimes depicted as a demonic warrior) guarding Buddhism and a goddess.
sen.cmt: オリジナルに合わせました。
sen.e: Kishimojin' or 'Kishibojin' (haaritii in Sanskrit, Goddess of Children) is a yasha (yaksha in Sanskrit, Buddhist deity sometimes depicted as a demonic warrior) guarding Buddhism and a goddess.

sen.j: 梵名ハーリティーを音写した（かりていも）とも言う。
sen.e: It is also called "Kariteimo" which is a transcription of Sanskrit name haaritii.
She is also called 'Kariteimo' which is a transcription of her name in Sanskrit 'Haaritii.'
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。後段で女神として説明されているので、she, herに統一。
sen.e: She is also called 'Kariteimo' which is a transcription of her name in Sanskrit 'Haaritii.'

sen.j: 三昧耶形は吉祥果（ザクロの実。種が多いことから多産・豊穣の象徴）。
sen.e: Her Sanma yagyo (characteristic things of the Buddha) is Kichijo-ka (pomegranate fruit which is a symbol of prolificacy and fertility because it has a lot of seeds).
Her Sanmayagyo (things for representing Buddha) is Kichijo-ka (pomegranate fruit which represents fertility and productiveness for having a lot of seeds).
Her Sanmayagyo (things for representing Buddha) is Kichijo-ka (pomegranate fruit which represents fertility and productiveness for having a lot of seeds).

sen.j: 種子 (密教)（種字）はウーン（huuM）。
sen.e: Her Shuji (the characteristic one syllable word to depict the Bodhisattva) (Esoteric Buddhism) is huuM.
Her shuji is huuM (shuji [種子 or 種字] is one syllable word for representing Bodhisattva, which is a distinctive idea of Esoteric Buddhism).
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: Her shuji is huuM (shuji [種子 or 種字] is one syllable word for representing Bodhisattva, which is a distinctive idea of Esoteric Buddhism).

sen.j: 夜叉毘沙門天（クベーラ）の部下の武将般闍迦（パンチーカ）の妻で、500人（一説には千人または1万人）の子の母。
sen.e: She was a wife of Panchika, a warrior who served Bishamonten (Vaisravana), yaksha, and the mother of 500 (or 1,000, 10,000) children.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: She was the wife of Hanshika (Panchika), a warrior who served a yasha, Bishamonten (Vaisravana), and the mother of 500 children (in some materials it is written as '1,000 children' or '10,000 children').

She was the wife of Hanshika (Panchika), a warrior who served a yasha, Bishamonten (Vaisravana), and the mother of 500 children (in some materials it is written as '1,000 children' or '10,000 children').

sen.j: しかし、常に他人の子を捕えて食べてしまうため、釈迦は彼女が最も愛していた末子・愛奴児（ピンガーラ 嬪伽羅）を隠して子を失う母親の苦しみを悟らせ、仏教に帰依させた。
sen.e: However, she always caught others' children and ate them, so that Shakyamuni hid her youngest child, Pingara, who she loved most, in order to let her know other mothers' suffering to lose a child and made her believe Buddhism.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the past she always caught others' children and ate them, so Buddha hid her youngest and favorite child Ainuru (Pingara) to let her know other mothers' suffering to lose a child and made her believe Buddhism.

In the past she always caught others' children and ate them, so Buddha hid her youngest and favorite child Ainuru (Pingara) to let her know other mothers' suffering to lose a child and made her believe Buddhism.

sen.j: 以後、仏法の護法善神となり、子供と安産の守り神となった。
sen.e: After that she became Goho zenjin (good deities protecting dharma) of Buddhism and a guardian deity of children and easy delivery.
After that she became Goho-zenjin (good deity keeping dharma) of Buddhism and a guardian deity of children and easy delivery.
After that she became Goho-zenjin (good deity keeping dharma) of Buddhism and a guardian deity of children and easy delivery.

sen.j: 盗難除けの守護とも言われる。
sen.e: She is also called a burglar-proof guardian deity.
She is also regarded as a deity preventing robbery.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: She is also regarded as a deity preventing robbery.

sen.j: インドでは、とりわけ子授け、安産、子育ての神として祀られた。
sen.e: In India she was enshrined especially as a goddess of blessing with children, easy delivery and raising children.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In India she had been worshiped especially as a goddess of pregnancy, easy delivery and raising children.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。この場合「祀る」はworship。
sen.e: In India she had been worshiped especially as a goddess of pregnancy, easy delivery and raising children.

sen.j: 日本でも密教の盛行に伴い、小児の息災や福徳を求めて、鬼子母神を本尊とする訶梨帝母法が修せられたり、上層貴族の間では、安産を願って訶梨帝母像を祀り、訶梨帝母法を修している。
sen.e: In Japan, in accordance with the flourish of Esoteric Buddhism, Kariteimo-ho (a method of Kariteimo in Esoteric Buddhism) in which Kishimojin is the main deity, was performed for good health, happiness and a fortune of children, and upper nobles enshrined a statue of Kariteimo for easy birth and performed Kariteimo-ho.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In Japan, as Esoteric Buddhism spread, people learnt Kariteimo-ho (a method for following Kariteimo [Kishimojin]) holding Kishimojin as the main deity for children's good health and happiness, and court nobles of the upper class not only learnt Kariteimo-ho but also enshrined the statues of Kariteimo for easy birth.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: In Japan, as Esoteric Buddhism spread, people learnt Kariteimo-ho (a method for following Kariteimo [Kishimojin]) holding Kishimojin as the main deity for children's good health and happiness, and court nobles of the upper class not only learnt Kariteimo-ho but also enshrined the statues of Kariteimo for easy birth.

sen.j: また、法華経では十羅刹女（じゅうらせつにょ）とともに鬼子母神が、法華信奉者の擁護と法華信仰弘通を妨げる者の処罰を誓っている。
sen.e: In addition, in Hokke-kyo Sutra (the Lotus Sutra), Kishimojin swears to guard the believers of Hokke-kyo and punish the people who prevent guzu or gutsu (missionary activities) of Hokke faith with Jurasetsunyo (Ten Demonesses).

In Hokke-kyo (Saddharmapundariika-sutra or the Lotus Sutra), Kishimojin, together with Jurasetsunyo (ten female rakshasas or ten demonesses), swears to guard the believers of Hokke-kyo and to punish the people who prevent 'guzu' (or 'gutsu,' the spread) of the beliefs in Hokke-kyo.
sen.cmt: 誤訳に対応しました。スタイルの統一。
sen.e: In Hokke-kyo (Saddharmapundariika-sutra or the Lotus Sutra), Kishimojin, together with Jurasetsunyo (ten female rakshasas or ten demonesses), swears to guard the believers of Hokke-kyo and to punish the people who prevent 'guzu' (or 'gutsu,' the spread) of the beliefs in Hokke-kyo.

sen.j: このことから、日蓮はこれに基づき文字で表現した法華曼荼羅に鬼子母神の号を連ね、鬼子母神と十羅刹女に母子の関係を設定している。
sen.e: For this reason, Nichiren included go (name) of Kishimojin on Hokke Mandala (lotus mandara) which was expressed with letters and set up the relationship of mother and child between Kishimojin and Jurasetsunyo.
For this reason, Nichiren included the name of Kishimojin in Hokke Mandala (the Lotus Mandala) which was formed of letters, and described that Kishimojin was the mother of Jurasetsunyo.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: For this reason, Nichiren included the name of Kishimojin in Hokke Mandala (the Lotus Mandala) which was formed of letters, and described that Kishimojin was the mother of Jurasetsunyo.

sen.j: このことが、法華曼荼羅の諸尊の彫刻化や絵像化が進むなかで、法華信奉者の守護神としての鬼子母神の単独表現の元となった。
sen.e: This led to the independent expression of Kishimojin as a guardian deity of Hokke-kyo believers through the process of making statues and pictures of the deities in Hokke Mandala.
This led to the independent expression of Kishimojin as a guardian deity of Hokke-kyo believers through the process of making statues and pictures of the deities in Hokke Mandala.
This led to the independent expression of Kishimojin as a guardian deity of Hokke-kyo believers through the process of making statues and pictures of the deities in Hokke Mandala.

sen.j: その像は天女のような姿をし、子供を1人（末子の愛好とされる）抱き、右手には吉祥果を持つ。
sen.e: Her figure was like Tennyo (Celestial Maidens) who held on a child (who is regarded as the youngest child, Pingara [愛好]) and had Kichijo-ka in her right hand.
Her figure had been made imitating Tennyo (celestial maiden) with a child (regarded as her youngest child, Ainuru) in her arms and Kichijo-ka in her right hand.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: Her figure had been made imitating Tennyo (celestial maiden) with a child (regarded as her youngest child, Ainuru) in her arms and Kichijo-ka in her right hand.

sen.j: 吉祥果は人肉の味がするから、とも言われるが、これは後になって付け加えられた話である。
sen.e: Although it is also said that she has Kichijo-ka because it tastes like human's meat, it was a fiction added in later years.
Someone say that she has Kichijo-ka because it tastes like human being's flesh, however that is a fiction added in later years.

sen.j: 鬼子母神は、法華経の守護神として日蓮宗・法華宗の寺院で祀られることが多い。
sen.e: Kishimojin is often enshrined in a temple of Nichiren sect and Hokke sect as a guardian deity of Hokke-kyo Sutra.
Kishimojin is often enshrined in temples of the Nichiren sect and the Hokke sect as a guardian deity of Hokke-kyo.
Kishimojin is often enshrined in temples of the Nichiren sect and the Hokke sect as a guardian deity of Hokke-kyo.

sen.j: 「恐れ入谷の鬼子母神」で知られる、東京都台東区入谷 (台東区)の鬼子母神（真源寺）、東京都豊島区雑司が谷の法明寺 (豊島区)、千葉県市川市の遠寿院の鬼子母神が有名である。
sen.e: The Kishimojin, which is known by the phrase 'Osore Iriya no Kishimojin', of the Shingen-ji Temple at Iriya, Taito Ward, Tokyo, the one of the Homyo-ji temple at Zoshigaya, Teshima Ward, Tokyo, and the one of the Onjuin Temple at Ichikawa City, Chiba Prefecture are famous.

Among many statues of Kishimojin in Japan, especially famous Kishimojin are the one known by the phrase 'Osore Iriya no Kishimojin' enshrined in Shingen-ji Temple (Iriya, Taito Ward, Tokyo), the one of Homyo-ji Temple (Zoshigaya, Toshima Ward, Tokyo), and the one of Onjuin Temple (Ichikawa City, Chiba Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 用語の統一。読みやすくしました。
sen.e: Among many statues of Kishimojin in Japan, especially famous Kishimojin are the one known by the phrase 'Osore Iriya no Kishimojin' enshrined in Shingen-ji Temple (Iriya, Taito Ward, Tokyo), the one of Homyo-ji Temple (Zoshigaya, Toshima Ward, Tokyo), and the one of Onjuin Temple (Ichikawa City, Chiba Prefecture).

sen.j: 縁日は毎月8の付く日（8日,18日,28日）である。
sen.e: The festival day is the days including 8 (8th, 18th and 28th) every month.

sen.e: In addition, some temples hold a grand festival at the time of anniversary of Founder's death (memorial service).
In addition, some temples hold grand festival for Kishimojin and the anniversary of their founder's death at the same time.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。

sen.j: なお、「鬼子母神」の「鬼」の表記について、寺院によっては、第一画目の点がない字を用いる場合がある。
sen.e: Moreover, some temples use the letter of 'ki' (鬼) of 'Kishimojin' (鬼子母神)without the first stroke.

sen.e: This is because Kishimojin changed her mind by Shakyamuni's teaching and took off her horn.

sen.j: 西遊記の雑劇である『鬼子母掲鉢記』、雑劇『西天取経』（呉昌齢）第12齣の鬼母帰依では愛奴児が三蔵法師を捕まえており、そこに登場し釈迦如来に帰依する。
sen.e: In the scene of Kimokie (Kishimojin became a believer) in the 12th act of "Kishimo Keihatsuki" (鬼子母掲鉢記) and "Saiten Shukyo" (Go Shorei [呉昌齢]) which are the Chinese classical theatrical plays of Journey to West, she appeared when Pingara caught Sanzohoshi and became a believer of Shaka Nyorai (Shakyamuni).
sen.cmt: 鬼子母掲鉢記、呉昌齢の定訳不明です。
sen.e: In some zatsugeki (zaju, Chinese classical play) adapted from "Saiyuki" (Xiyouji, Journey to the West) including "Kishibo Keihatsu-ki" (Guizumu Qibo-ji, Kishimojin Holds a Bowl) and the scene of 'Kibo Kie' (Guimu Guiyi, Kishimojin Becomes a Believer) in the 12th act of "Saiten Shukyo" (Xitian Qujing, Obtaining Sutras in the West) written by Wu Changling, after Ainuru captures Sanzo-hoshi (Sanzang fashi, Priest Xuan Zang), Kishimojin appears and obeys Buddha.
sen.cmt: スタイルの統一。中国語読み。
sen.e: In some zatsugeki (zaju, Chinese classical play) adapted from "Saiyuki" (Xiyouji, Journey to the West) including "Kishibo Keihatsu-ki" (Guizumu Qibo-ji, Kishimojin Holds a Bowl) and the scene of 'Kibo Kie' (Guimu Guiyi, Kishimojin Becomes a Believer) in the 12th act of "Saiten Shukyo" (Xitian Qujing, Obtaining Sutras in the West) written by Wu Changling, after Ainuru captures Sanzo-hoshi (Sanzang fashi, Priest Xuan Zang), Kishimojin appears and obeys Buddha.

sen.j: 明以降の西遊記では紅孩児の回で観音菩薩のところで一箇所取次ぎに顔をだすのみになった。
sen.e: In the Journey to West after Ming, she only appeared once at the place of Kannon Bosatsu (Kannon Buddhisattva) in order to rely a message in the act of Kogaizi (紅孩児).
sen.cmt: 紅孩児の定訳不明です。
sen.e: However, in "Saiyuki" written after the Ming dynasty, Kishimojin appears only once in the scene of Kogaiji (Honghaier) to tell a message to Kannon Bodhisattva.
sen.cmt: 写し間違いに対応しました。わかりやすくしました。
